content.question: A ball of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> swings in a horizontal circle at the end of a string of radius <math alttext="R " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at an initial tangential speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> as it undergoes uniform centripetal motion. A student gradually pulls the string inward such that the radius of the circle decreases, as shown in the figure. Which of the following predictions is correct regarding the angular momentum and rotational inertia of the ball about the axis of revolution as the ball is pulled inward?

choices.label: The angular momentum of the ball increases. The rotational inertia of the ball about the axis of revolution decreases.
The angular momentum of the ball increases. The rotational inertia of the ball about the axis of revolution stays the same.
The angular momentum of the ball remains constant. The rotational inertia of the ball about the axis of revolution decreases.
The angular momentum of the ball remains constant. The rotational inertia of the ball about the axis of revolution stays the same.

content.answer: The angular momentum of the ball remains constant. The rotational inertia of the ball about the axis of revolution decreases.
